column1: Celepharn was the son of [[Mallor]] and the father of [[Celebrindor]]; he came to the throne of [[Arthedain]] upon the death of his father in {{TA

column1: Celepharn ruled Arthedain for eighty-one years, and was succeeded by his son, Celebrindor, upon his death in {{TA
The etymology of Celepharn's name is unknown. [[Robert Foster]] categorizes the name as [[Sindarin]].<ref>{{HM
column2: Guide}}, (entry for ''Celepharn'')</ref> [[David Salo]] proposes that it might be composed of ''[[celeb]]'' ("silver") + [[lenition
column4: GS}}, p. 346</ref>; in this case, ''ph'' should not represent ''f'', but two sounds pronounced separately as "celep-harn".

column1: Earlier, Anthony Bryant speculated that the second element is a derivative of the [[Sundocarme
